roleset.name: to force, drive

example.name: all arguments
example.text: He recently voted `` present '' when the committee authorized a subpoena [0]-1 [*T*-2] to compel Mr. Keating to testify [*T*-1] , then changed his vote to yes .

example.name: passive
example.text: That is , he-2 is being compelled [*-2] to put them on the market too soon , and has already gotten offers that are less than he paid for some of the art works .
example.arg: to put them on the market too soon

example.name: passive with adverbials
example.text: Thus , in a criminal case , a prosecutor can not comment on a defendant 's failure to testify nor can [the defendant]-1 be compelled [*-1] to take the stand as a witness , thus forcing him to `` take the Fifth . ''
example.arg: to take the stand as a witness
thus [*] forcing him to `` take the Fifth

roleset.note: Based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Member of VNcls force-59. Comparison with 'force'.
